title: Sign of the coming Apocalypse ???
content:
House Industries designs some of the world's finest type... but this is just flat-out wrong.

[http://www.theonion.com/content/from\_print/wrong\_font\_chosen\_for](http://web.archive.org/web/20101227075552/http:/www.theonion.com/content/from_print/wrong_font_chosen_for "http://www.theonion.com/content/from\_print/wrong\_font\_chosen\_for")

And perhaps an interior design buff here might remember an advert for a pop-art themed Bisazza mosaic tile motif also featuring a scandalous showing of Countryhouse.

Folks- start building those backyard fallout shelters.

Mikey :-)
author: SuperUltraFabulous

comments.content: I find it somewhat amusing, to be honest. The person who chose the font probably did too.
Honestly, it doesn't bother me much- it (hopefully) tells me more about what the person was like than what the usual gravestone would.
I believe James worked at the Willy Wonka factory for many years, so the font choice is fitting. He lived in a world of pure imagination.
oh, The Onion, they never stop.

Are you kidding me? This is FANTASTIC!! I didn't even know you could get a custom font on a headstone like this...this opens up possiblities. Now all I have to do is decide which one of my fonts I want on mine...what better way to leave a testimonial to my life. Of course that's AT LEAST 50 years away :)

hilarious. i'm pretty sure that's a photoshop fake, but it does raise some enticing possibilities for custom gravestones. the technology today allows it.  
template guided precision grinding, etc.

i might go for the controversial "the last stonecutter just died" look...  
just to aggravate the type snobs !

groan. sorry i couldn't resist  
;-)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20101227075552im_/http:/typophile.com/files/grave_5874.jpg)

That's obviously Photoshop, but yes, you could get any font you want laser-etched into a headstone. There is actually a market for [hideous themed tombstones](http://web.archive.org/web/20101227075552/http:/www.pacificcoastmemorials.com/gallery.php?gallery=hand_etched_art), so maybe designers should start getting into that business and clean them up a little
